content: Rohan, attached is v1.0 of your personal Peak Performance Playbook. It captures the nutrition, stress prep, and biofeedback routines that worked for your keynote. This is now a permanent asset in your toolkit 💼.
Great timing, Neel. I’ll read it later today—keen to lock this in as a repeatable system.
Morning Rohan ☀️ Just confirming—Sarah has locked in your first consultation with Dr. Alice Chen (clinical psychologist) for Feb 10, 2pm SGT. Calendar invite already sent.
Got it, thanks Ruby. Appreciate the smooth coordination 🙏

Rohan, to support Dr. Chen’s work, I recommend trialing a continuous daytime HRV monitor. It'll show us how specific meetings/tasks impact your nervous system. That way, we can fine-tune stress resilience strategies.
So Oura gives me the overnight 'recharge' score, while this new monitor would show the real-time 'drain' during the day? Almost like battery management?
Exactly 👌 Perfect analogy—Oura = how well you recharge, daytime HRV monitor = how fast you’re draining. Together, we’ll see the full energy system.
I’ll arrange the HRV monitor delivery this week. Sarah will receive setup instructions too. You won’t need to do anything extra.
Perfect, thanks Ruby. Seamless as always.
How did the fasted cardio feel yesterday, Rohan? Any dizziness or fatigue after 25 mins? Just want to calibrate intensity.
Actually felt solid, Rachel. A bit lightheaded at the 20-min mark but recovered quickly after hydrating.
👍 That’s expected. Let’s cap it at 20 min for now, gradually nudging up once we see better tolerance.
Quick note, Rohan—the carb reintroduction is looking very smooth. No major glucose spikes logged by Sarah’s meal pics. Your system’s adapting well.
Good to hear. I actually felt sharper in the morning meetings after the rice last night.
That’s exactly why the Playbook includes carb cycling around big events—energy + focus without crashes. It’s now a system, not a gamble.
Reminder: diagnostic panel scheduled for Feb 17. Sarah’s already synced travel dates so you’ll be in Singapore. Nothing needed from you right now ✅
Nice, thanks Ruby. Keeping this off my plate is huge.
Rohan, as part of your Feb diagnostic, I recommend we include APOE4 genetic testing. It provides insights into long-term heart and Alzheimer’s risk. A single blood draw can cover it.
Makes sense, Dr. Warren. If it helps us see my long-term risk profile, let’s do it.
Noted ✅ I’ll add APOE4 to your Feb 17 requisition. No extra appointments needed.
Side note: the new HRV monitor will help us tag specific meetings as stress triggers. Over time, we’ll build a personal 'stress fingerprint'.
Got it. That kind of mapping feels very actionable. Looking forward to testing it.
Cook shared tonight’s meal pic—balanced, portion spot on. Small tweak: swap the sauce to olive oil + lemon instead of cream to keep lipids lower.
Noted. I actually prefer the olive oil version anyway 👍
Quick check—how’s your energy this week with the 20-min morning sessions + carbs back in?
Feels balanced. Not dragging like before. Even recovery after late calls is quicker.
That’s a win ✅ Let’s hold steady on this routine until the Feb panel.
Rohan, I see a good opportunity—once we map your stress fingerprint, we can extend the Playbook to 'Board Meeting Protocols'. Would that be useful?
Yes, absolutely. Board weeks are where I need max sharpness. Let’s plan for that.
Just a heads up—HRV monitor will be delivered tomorrow. Sarah will set it aside for your Monday start.
Once the monitor’s on, you’ll see live feedback during calls. I’ll share a quick 'how-to' video with Sarah for setup.
Good. Keep it dummy-proof—I don’t have bandwidth to fiddle with tech.
Understood 👍 One button on/off. Sarah can handle the rest.
Cook shared lunch logs—looks consistent. Just suggest adding a fermented food twice a week (kimchi or miso) to boost gut diversity.
Noted, Carla. Kimchi’s easy for me—I’ll ask cook to add it.
Morning! Just confirming you’re set for next week: Feb 10 Dr. Chen, Feb 17 diagnostics. No action needed from your side ✅
Thanks Ruby, that’s perfect. Appreciate the clear updates.
Rohan, note on APOE4: regardless of outcome, we’ll focus on lifestyle first. Genes guide risk, but environment drives expression. Nothing to worry about—just better data.
Understood, Dr. Warren. Data without panic—that’s what I need.
Team consolidation note: Playbook delivered, Dr. Chen confirmed, diagnostics ready, HRV monitor live tomorrow. We’ve now systemized both physical and psychological pillars.
